alert.note: Alert for Chase; Hayes; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson; Perkins (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 5:10PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Showers and thunderstorms with strong gusty winds will impact portions of Perkins, eastern Keith, northern Chase, northwestern Lincoln, southwestern McPherson and northwestern Hayes Counties through 600 PM CDT/500 PM MDT/... At 508 PM CDT/408 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Tryon to near Keystone to near Venango. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. 1/2 mile visibility in blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility in periods of blowing dust will make driving hazardous. Locations impacted include... Imperial, Grant, Sutherland, Hershey, Paxton, Wallace, Madrid, Venango, Elsie, Sarben, Sutherland Reservoir State Recreation Area, Roscoe, Grainton, Brandon, Coker, O`Fallons, Nevens, Broganville, Big Bald Hill and Wild Horse Spring. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 41 and 83. Highway 92 between mile markers 189 and 193. Highway 97 between mile markers 7 and 20. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 130 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Slow down when driving in poor visibility.

area.areaDesc: Chase; Hayes; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson; Perkins
